discussion.content: License is needed. Look at point 5 - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/clients/outlook-for-ios-and-android/use-hybrid-modern-auth?view=exchserver-2019#technical-and-licensing-requirements

B
The identities are on-premise for both EXO and on-prem but most likely you will want to configure the mobile access to utilize modern authentication which has MFA. Also this will allow you to have conditional access and ability to use app policies to protect your data. Hence, the device policy should be setup in EXO.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/clients/outlook-for-ios-and-android/use-hybrid-modern-auth?view=exchserver-2019

comments.content: I think that it is on-prem because if you create an exchange online mobile device access policy the users who are on-prem will not be affected. Isn't it

choices.D: From the on-premises organization, create a mobile device access policy.
choices.C: Add a TXT record to the public DNS zone of the Exchange organization.
choices.A: For each on-premises user, purchase a Microsoft Office 365 Enterprise E1 license.
choices.B: From Exchange Online, create a mobile device access policy.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Exchange Server 2019 hybrid deployment. The on-premises Exchange organization contains 500 mailboxes. The Exchange Online tenant contains 200 mailboxes.
You need to ensure that all users can use the Microsoft Outlook mobile app to access their mailbox.
What should you do first?

Your company has a Microsoft Exchange Server 2019 hybrid deployment.
The company has a finance department.
You need to move all the on-premises mailboxes of the finance department to Exchange Online. The bulk of the move operation must occur during a weekend when the company's Internet traffic is lowest. The move must then be finalized the following Monday. The solution must minimize disruption to end users.
What should you do first?

discussion.content:
A
B: This would start and end immediately which is not what we wanted.
C: This will means the “Bulk” of the actions will start immediately during office hours which is wrong. This is often used when the bandwidth isn’t a imitation.
D: Then the mailboxes would not have time to go live and cause disruption to the users.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/exchange/new-migrationbatch?view=exchange-ps

choices.A: Run the New-MigrationBatch cmdlet and specify the StartAfter parameter.
choices.B: Create a batch migration and select the Automatically complete the migration batch check box.
choices.C: Run the New-MigrationBatch cmdlet and specify the CompleteAfter parameter.
choices.D: Create a script that moves most of the mailboxes on Friday at 22:00 and the remaining mailboxes on Monday at 09:00.

discussion.content:
• Enable the MRS proxy endpoint on all servers.
• Configure the SMTP to use a third-party certificate.
You need to enable MRS proxy on all server not just 1.
IMAP is only used for Gmail or legacy third party migrations. Also emails are delivered using SMTP not IMAP. Exchange online uses third-party certificate where it can verify the connection. Only federation uses self-signed certificate which the HCW creates automatically.
Totally agreed, the answer should be changed

(Office 365)

comments.content: All user and mailbox changes happen on premise for hybrid scenarios

discussion.content: Both should be EAC in a hybrid scenario.

Agree with Ronnie123, both are in EAC Exchange On-Premises using enable-remotemailbox cmdlet available only in Exchange On-Premises.
https://social.technet.microsoft.com/wiki/contents/articles/51966.office-365-hybrid-enabling-in-place-archive-with-powershell.aspx
http://cloudexchangers.com/enable-archive-mailbox-in-exchange-hybrid/

Both are enabled on the on-premise server.
Since the question did not state, I assume that both user identity is synced from on-prem which means the archive must be enabled on-prem where the identity is based in. If the user is only on the cloud then the EXO EAC should be used.

N: The forwarding configuration isn't copied to Exchange Online when the mailbox is migrated there. 
N: User4 is not yet migrated and hence the permissions needs to be explicitly added after the migration.
Y: Because user3 is already migrated, the permissions will stay when migrated.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/exchange-hybrid
